title: Can't access the Suite Administration homepage
content:
You can't access the Suite Administration homepage.

Cause

Some components related to Suite Administration are offline.

Solution

  1. Check the status of all components that are listed in the following table and see if any component is Offline.
    If there is any Offline component, log in to a control plane node of the suite and then run the kubectl get pods --all-namespaces | grep bo command to display a list.

    Namespace

    Name

    Ready

    Status

    Restarts

    Age

    itsma1

    itom-bo-ats-deployment-2381770964-7kl0z

    2/2

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    itom-bo-config-deployment-3968815872-ltn9r

    2/2

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    itom-bo-facade-deployment-195710758-kmk1h

    2/2

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    itom-bo-fo-ui-deployment-3602721999-w9qcl

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    itom-bo-license-deployment-566314642-jdlhp

    2/2

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    itom-bo-login-deployment-3358911537-t0pct

    2/2

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    itom-bo-postgres-deployment-3330931767-4p1dr

    2/2

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    itom-bo-reset-password-deployment-528641890-1h8rh

    2/2

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    itom-bo-ui-deployment-1538401878-hr2bn

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    itom-bo-user-deployment-2262226977-pbq0r 

    2/2

    Running

    0

    1d

    itsma1

    itom-bo-user-offline-deployment-1151385310-xgl04

    1/1

    Running

    0

    1d
  2. If the value in the Status column isn't Running, or the value in the Ready column is "0/1" or "1/2", run the kubectl logs <POD NAME> -n <NAMESPACE> -c <Container Name> command to check the log.
